post.title: Easy Garlic-Herb Bread
post.content:
Ingredients:

4 ½ – 5 Cups of bread flour

1 Tbsp sugar

2 ½ tsp salt

2 ½ tsp instant yeast

1 ⅔ Cups warm water

5 cloves of garlic, minced finely

1 Tbsp fresh or dried rosemary

1 Tbsp fresh or dried thyme

INSTRUCTIONS:

1. Mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl until the dough starts to form.

2. Transfer the dough onto lightly floured surface and knead for 6-8 minutes*. Form the dough into a ball.

3. Brush a large bowl with oil and transfer the dough into the bowl. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and put the bowl in a warm place, to let the dough rise. Let it rise for 1 hour.

4. When time is up, separate the dough in half, trying not to handle it too much. Form 2 loaves and place them onto a baking tray, leaving extra space around each loaf. Preheat the oven to 450 F. Leave your loaves in a warm place for 40 – 50 minutes.

5. Once time is up and bread has risen once more, place it in the oven and bake for 20 – 25 minutes. When ready, bread should be golden-brown and sound hollow if you tap on it.

* If the dough sticks to the hands and is hard to handle, add more flour a little bit at a time, until it stops sticking to your hands when kneaded.
